intro: Gomphrena filaginoides, commonly known as the Mexican feather grass, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and feathery, pink or red bracts that resemble plumes. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Gomphrena filaginoides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive, long-lasting foliage and unique appearance.
